Package com.ftp.server

Class FTPServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ftp.server.FTPServer

  • public class FTPServer
extends java.lang.Object
    This is basic class that represents FTP server. It uses Socket for opening connection with given port and communicate with FTPTransferObject. It has 2 main threads, one for reading and one for writing to socket input/output stream assigned to each client. Upon client connecting, after creating key for encryption it reads username and password as plain String and after that, if credentials are correct, client can get it's own socket, then runs read thread which is responsible for listening and reading FTPTransferObject from each client. On client connected, server sends object to client that contains TreeItem with folders/files from it. Thread for writing to socket output stream runs on command received from client, while reading thread for each client works infinitely (until client disconnect).

    • Constructor Detail

      • FTPServer

        public FTPServer​(int port)

    • Method Detail

      • createSocket

        public void createSocket​()
                  throws java.io.IOException
        This method opens connection on given port and server is ready for accepting connections. When client connects, server reads it's credentials, and if they are correct server creates ClientConnection object and add client to list of active clients. Connected client will get it's own socket and thread responsible for reading and writing to it's socket. After that first object with repository explorer will be sent to client. On failed authentication server refuses connection.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • readFromSocket

        public void readFromSocket​(ClientConnection client)
        This method is responsible for listening to each client socket and reading commands from it. After client sends FTPTransferObject server receives it and reads FTPCommand. Depends on command certain actions are performed, some of them locally some of them returns file to client.
        Parameters:
        client - The client for whom this thread is responsible

      • writeToSocket

        public void writeToSocket​(ClientConnection client,
                          java.io.File path,
                          FTPCommand command,
                          java.lang.Integer response,
                          java.lang.String responseMessage)
        This method writes object to each client. It can contain file or just response message after executing file deletion or folder creation for example.
        Parameters:
        client - The client for whom this thread is responsible
        path - Path from local file
        command - FTPCommand.SUCCESS or FTPCommand.FAILURE depends on command execution
        response - Response code
        responseMessage - Response message

      • readObjectFromStream

        public FTPTransferObject readObjectFromStream​(ClientConnection client)
                                       throws java.io.IOException,
                                              java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        This method is responsible for reading serialized object from client input stream. First it reads size of object represented as String, then reads object with that size.
        Parameters:
        client - Client which stream needs to be read
        Returns:
        Read object
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException

      • readFileFromStream

        public void readFileFromStream​(ClientConnection client,
                               FTPTransferObject readObject)
                        throws java.io.IOException
        This method reads file that was sent from client. It is decrypted after receiving every chunk (512 bytes).
        Parameters:
        client - Client that send file
        readObject - Object that contains file size and other file related properties
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if there is problem with file creation or other.

      • writeFileToStream

        public void writeFileToStream​(ClientConnection client,
                              java.io.File pathServer,
                              boolean empty)
                       throws java.io.IOException
        This method writes file to stream. It encrypts file chunks (512 bytes) and sends them.
        Parameters:
        client - Client to whom file needs to be sent
        pathServer - Server side path of file that needs to be sent
        empty - If file don't need to be sent (considering that this method is called always on every object receiving) this parameter is set to false
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If there is problem with server file

      • writeObjectToStream

        public void writeObjectToStream​(ClientConnection client,
                                java.io.File pathClient,
                                java.io.File pathServer,
                                FTPCommand command,
                                java.lang.Integer response,
                                java.lang.String responseMessage)
                         throws java.io.IOException
        This method sends serialized FTPTransferObject to certain client with necessary data. This can be response message, tree explorer...
        Parameters:
        client - Client to whom object needs to be sent
        pathClient - Path from client side (for obtaining file properties)
        pathServer - Path from server side
        command - FTP command
        response - Response code for client
        responseMessage - Response message for client
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if there is problem with certain file
